radiographic_examinations.findings: High signal abnormalities in basal ganglia; abnormal signal intensity in the putamen bilaterally without mass effect or contrast enhancement.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI demonstrated abnormal signal intensity in the putamen bilaterally without mass effect or contrast enhancement. A subsequent MRI at age 26 showed new bilaterally symmetric signal intensity abnormalities in the medial inferior thalami, the decussation of the superior cerebellar peduncle, and within periaqueductal gray matter.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Elevation of the lactate peak and depression of the N-acetylaspartate peak in the basal ganglia and periaqueductal lesions.

radiographic_examinations.date: 7 days after the onset of deafness
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral gadolinium enhancement of the intracanalicular portions of the seventh and eighth nerve complexes consistent with inflammatory neuritis.
